meanings.definition: Capable of being endured or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: The long hike was endurable for the experienced hiker.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather was endurable with a good raincoat.
meanings.sent3: The endurable wait for the bus made the passengers antsy.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as endurable as a sturdy oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The endurable pain in his leg slowly faded away.

meanings.definition: Able to withstand hardship or suffering.
meanings.sent1: The endurable soldier never gave up in tough situations.
meanings.sent2: The endurable fabric of the tent kept them dry during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The endurable marathon runner crossed the finish line with a smile.
meanings.sent4: Her spirit was as endurable as a diamond under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The endurable endurance of the team impressed everyone.
